questions.text:
#### Q1. In which of these situations are interfaces better than abstract classes?

- %OPTION% When you need to define an object type's characteristics, use an interface. When you need to define an object type's capabilities, use an abstract class.
- %OPTION% Interfaces are a legacy of older versions of C#, and are interchangeable with the newer abstract class feature.
- %OPTION% When you need a list of capabilities and data that are classes-agnostic, use an interface. When you need a certain object type to share characteristics, use an abstract class.
- %OPTION% You should use both an interface and an abstract class when defining any complex object.

#### Q2. Which statement is true of delegates?

- %OPTION% Delegates are not supported in the current version of C#
- %OPTION% They cannot be used as callbacks.
- %OPTION% Only variables can be passed to delegates as parameters.
- %OPTION% They can be chained together.

[Official documentation: Delegates](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/programming-guide/delegates/#delegates-overview)

#### Q3. Which choice best defines C#'s asynchronous programming model?

- %OPTION% reactive
- %OPTION% inherited callback
- %OPTION% task-based
- %OPTION% callback-based

[Official documentation: Task asynchronous programming model](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/programming-guide/concepts/async/task-asynchronous-programming-model) resposta correta --> var contacts = new List<string>();

#### Q4. How would you determine if a class has a particular attribute?

- %OPTION% .

```cs
var type = typeof(SomeType);
var attribute = type.GetCustomAttribute<SomeAttribute>();
```

- %OPTION% .

```cs
var typeof(MyPresentationModel).Should().BeDecoratedWith<SomeAttribute>();
```

- %OPTION% .

```cs
Attribute.GetCustomAttribute, typeof(SubControllerActionToViewDataAttribute)
```

- %OPTION% .

```cs
Attribute.GetCustomAttribute(typeof(ExampleController), typeof(SubControllerActionToViewDataAttribute))
```

1. [Official documentation: Attribute Class](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.attribute?view=net-5.0)
2. [Official documentation: Attribute.GetCustomAttribute Method](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.attribute.getcustomattribute?view=net-5.0)

#### Q5. What is the difference between the ref and out keywords?

- %OPTION% Variables passed to out specify that the parameter is an output parameter, while ref specifies that a variable may be passed to a function without being initialized.
- %OPTION% Variables passed to ref can be passed to a function without being initialized, while out specifies that the value is a reference value that can be changed inside the calling method.
- %OPTION% Variables passed to out can be passed to a function without being initialized, while ref specifies that the value is a reference value that can be changed inside the calling method.
- %OPTION% Variables passed to ref specify that the parameter is an output parameter, while out specifies that a variable may be passed to a function without being initialized.

1. [Official documentation: ref](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/language-reference/keywords/ref)
2. [Official documentation: out parameter modifier](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/language-reference/keywords/out-parameter-modifier)

#### Q6. How could you retrieve information about a class, as well as create an instance at runtime?

- %OPTION% reflection
- %OPTION% serialization
- %OPTION% abstraction
- %OPTION% dependency injection

[Official documentation: Reflection ](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/programming-guide/concepts/reflection)

#### Q8. What is the difference between an anonymous type and a regular data type?

- %OPTION% Anonymous types don't have type names
- %OPTION% Anonymous types can only be static
- %OPTION% Anonymous types can be used only in struts
- %OPTION% Anonymous types don't work with LINQ.

[Official documentation: Anonymous Types](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/fundamentals/types/anonymous-types)

#### Q9. When would you use a Dictionary rather that an Array type in your application?

- %OPTION% when you need a jagged collection structure
- %OPTION% when you need to store values of the same type
- %OPTION% when you need to store key-value pairs rather than single values
- %OPTION% when you need an ordered, searchable list

[Official documentation: Dictionary<TKey,TValue> Class](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.collections.generic.dictionary-2?view=net-5.0)

#### Q10. What is the difference between a.Equals(b) and a == b?

- %OPTION% The .Equals method compares reference identities while the `==` compares contents.
- %OPTION% The .Equals method compares primitive values while `==` compares all values.
- %OPTION% The .Equals method compares contents while `==` compares reference identity.
- %OPTION% The .Equals method compares reference type while `==` compares primitive value types

1. [Official documentation: Object.Equals](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.object.equals)
2. [c-sharpcorner: Equality Operator(==) vs .Equals()](https://www.c-sharpcorner.com/UploadFile/3d39b4/difference-between-operator-and-equals-method-in-C-Sharp)

#### Q11. Which choice best describes a deadlock situation?

- %OPTION% when you try to instantiate two objects at the same time in the same class or struct
- %OPTION% when you are trying to execute an action after a user event is registered
- %OPTION% when simultaneous instructions are waiting on each other to finish before executing
- %OPTION% when you try to execute a series of events simultaneously on multiple threads

[Official documentation: Deadlocks and race conditions](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/threading/managed-threading-best-practices#deadlocks-and-race-conditions)

#### Q12. How does the async keyword work?

- %OPTION% It allows access to asynchronous methods in the C# API
- %OPTION% It allows thread pooling and synchronous processes in static classes.
- %OPTION% It allows the await keyword to be used in a method
- %OPTION% It allows access to synchronous methods in the C# API

[Official documentation: async](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/language-reference/keywords/async)

#### Q13. What is an object in C#?

- %OPTION% a class or struct, including its variables and functions
- %OPTION% a primitive data type that can be created only at compile time
- %OPTION% a value type that can be used only with an abstract class
- %OPTION% an instance of a class or struct that includes fields, properties, and/or methods

[Official documentation: Objects](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/fundamentals/object-oriented/objects)

#### Q14. Which code snippet declares an anonymous type named userData?

- %OPTION% `var<<!---->T> userData = new <<!---->T> { name = "John", age = 32 };`
- %OPTION% `var userData = new { name = "John", age = 32 };`
- %OPTION% `AType userData = new AType { name = "John", age = 32 };`
- %OPTION% `Anonymous<T> userData = new Anonymous<T> { name = "John", age = 32 };`

[Official documentation: Anonymous Types](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/fundamentals/types/anonymous-types)

#### Q15. What will be returned when this method is executed?

`public void userInput(string charParameters) { }`

- %OPTION% nothing
- %OPTION% a Boolean
- %OPTION% a string variable
- %OPTION% an integer

[Official documentation: void](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/language-reference/builtin-types/void)

#### Q17. Lambda expressions are often used in tandem with which of the following?

- %OPTION% Namespaces
- %OPTION% LINQ
- %OPTION% Type Aliasing
- %OPTION% Assemblies

[Official documentation: Language Integrated Query (LINQ) Overview](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/programming-guide/concepts/linq/)

#### Q18. What is the correct formatting for single line and multiline comments?

- %OPTION% `/_/ - Single Line`
      `/_ - Multiline`
- %OPTION% `// Multiline`
      `/_ Single Line _/`
- %OPTION% `//\* Multiline`
      `/ Single Line`
- %OPTION% `// Single Line`
      `/* Multiline */`

[w3schools: C# Comments](https://www.w3schools.com/cs/cs_comments.php)

#### Q19. How do you make a method in an abstract class overridable?

- %OPTION% Make it public
- %OPTION% Make it static
- %OPTION% Make it private
- %OPTION% Make it virtual

1. [Official documentation: virtual](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/language-reference/keywords/virtual)
2. [Official documentation: abstract](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/language-reference/keywords/abstract)

#### Q21. What is an abstract class?

- %OPTION% a class that is denoted by the class keyword (can be seen and used by any other class in the system--thus it is by default public)
- %OPTION% something denoted by the abstract keyword and used system wide; if you want any program to create an object of a class you use the abstract class
- %OPTION% a class that is denoted by the virtual keyword
- %OPTION% a class that can be used only as base class

[Official documentation: Abstract and Sealed Classes and Class Members](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/programming-guide/classes-and-structs/abstract-and-sealed-classes-and-class-members)

#### Q22. When using a thread pool what happens to a given thread after it finishes its task?

- %OPTION% The thread is destroyed and memory is freed up.
- %OPTION% The thread runs in loop until the next assignment.
- %OPTION% The thread goes inactive in the background and waits for garbage collection.
- %OPTION% The thread returns to the pool for reuse.

[Official documentation: Thread pool characteristics](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/threading/the-managed-thread-pool#thread-pool-characteristics)

#### Q23. Which choice represents a class that inherits behavior from a base class?

- %OPTION% a second base class
- %OPTION% a revised class
- %OPTION% a derived class
- %OPTION% a parent class

[Official documentation: Inheritance](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/fundamentals/object-oriented/inheritance)

#### Q24. What does operator overloading allow you to do?

- %OPTION% hide built-in operators when necessary
- %OPTION% add methods to be interpreted by the compiler at runtime
- %OPTION% define how enums and other primitive value types work within the rest of the application
- %OPTION% define custom functionality for common operators like addition and equality

[Official documentation: Operator overloading](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/language-reference/operators/operator-overloading)

#### Q25. What is the main purpose of LINQ?

- %OPTION% to delete duplicate data
- %OPTION% to bind namespaces and assemblies
- %OPTION% to query and transform data
- %OPTION% to connect assemblies

[Official documentation: Language Integrated Query (LINQ) Overview](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/programming-guide/concepts/linq/#query-expression-overview)

#### Q27. What is the difference between throw exceptions and throw clauses?

- %OPTION% Throw clauses fire only at runtime, while throw exceptions can fire at any time.
- %OPTION% Throw exceptions overwrite the stack trace, while throw clauses retain the stack information.
- %OPTION% Throw clauses overwrite the stack trace, while throw exceptions retain the stack information.
- %OPTION% Throw exceptions fire only at runtime, while throw clauses can fire during compile time.

1. [Official documentation: throw](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/language-reference/keywords/throw)
2. [c-sharpcorner: Difference Between Throw Exception and Throw Clause](https://www.c-sharpcorner.com/UploadFile/akkiraju/difference-between-throw-exception-and-throw-clause/)

#### Q28. When an asynchronous method is executed, the code runs but nothing happens other than a compiler warning. What is most likely causing the method to not return anything?

- %OPTION% The return yield statement is missing at the end of the method.
- %OPTION% The method is missing an await keyword in its body.
- %OPTION% The wait keyword is missing from the end of the method.
- %OPTION% The yield keyword is missing from the method.

[Official documentation: Starting tasks concurrently](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/programming-guide/concepts/async/#start-tasks-concurrently)

#### Q29. What are C# events?

- %OPTION% system actions that communicate directly with the compiler at runtime
- %OPTION% actions that execute when the code compiles, generating logs and test output
- %OPTION% actions that generate notifications, which are sent to their registered listeners
- %OPTION% user-only methods that send data to the application's back end

[Official documentation: Introduction to events](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/events-overview)

#### Q30. What kind of values can arrays store?

- %OPTION% unordered collections of numeric values
- %OPTION% key-value pairs of any C# supported type
- %OPTION% class and struct instances
- %OPTION% multiple variables, or collections, of the same type

[Official documentation: Arrays](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/programming-guide/arrays/)

#### Q32. What character would you use to start a regular expression pattern at a word boundary?

- %OPTION% d
- %OPTION% \a
- %OPTION% \b
- %OPTION% \w

1. [regular-expressions: Word Boundaries](https://www.regular-expressions.info/wordboundaries.html)
2. [Official documentation: Regular Expression Language - Quick Reference](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/base-types/regular-expression-language-quick-reference)

#### Q34. You're dealing with multiple assemblies in your program, but are worried about memory allocation. At what point in the program life cycle are assemblies loaded into memory?

- %OPTION% at runtime
- %OPTION% at compile time
- %OPTION% only when required
- %OPTION% only when programmatically loaded

1. [Official documentation: Assembly Loading](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/framework/deployment/best-practices-for-assembly-loading)
2. [Stackoverflow : When exactly are assemblies loaded?](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/21914692/when-exactly-are-assemblies-loaded)

#### Q35. What is most accurate description of a regular expression?

- %OPTION% A regular expression is a C# tool used to parse HTML
- %OPTION% A regular expression is a special text string for describing a search patters.
- %OPTION% A regular expression allows a variable to be passed by reference.
- %OPTION% A regular expression allows a class to conform to the Equatable protocol.

1. [Official documentation: Regular Expression Language - Quick Reference](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/base-types/regular-expression-language-quick-reference)
2. [Official documentation: .NET regular expressions](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/base-types/regular-expressions)

#### Q36. Why would you use a class field in C#

- %OPTION% To define behaviours of the class
- %OPTION% To hold information and data contained in the class object
- %OPTION% To communicate between classes and object
- %OPTION% To store the class definition value

[Official documentation: Introduction to classes](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/fundamentals/types/classes)

#### Q37. When would you use generics in your code?

- %OPTION% to increase code performance
- %OPTION% all of these answers
- %OPTION% when code reuse is a priority
- %OPTION% when type safety is important

[Official documentation: Generic classes and methods](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/fundamentals/types/generics)

#### Q40. What is the difference between non-static and static classes?

- %OPTION% non-static classes need to be initialized before use, while static classes do not
- %OPTION% non-static classes are accessible only from an interface while static classes are accessible from anywhere
- %OPTION% non-static classes need to initialize all class members at runtime, while static classes do not
- %OPTION% non-static classes do not need to be initialized while static classes do

1. [stackoverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/20451554/whats-the-function-of-a-static-constructor-in-a-non-static-class)
2. [Official documentation: Static Constructors](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/programming-guide/classes-and-structs/static-constructors)

#### Q41. Which characteristic prevents this code from compiling?

`public int age="28"`

- %OPTION% type safety
- %OPTION% single inheritance
- %OPTION% dependency injection
- %OPTION% multiple inheritance

[c-sharpcorner: Type Safety in .NET](https://www.c-sharpcorner.com/UploadFile/vikie4u/type-safety-in-net/)

#### Q42. How would you serialize this class?

`public class User {}`

- %OPTION% Mark the User class with the `DeserializableAttribute`.
- %OPTION% Declare the class as `public serializable class User {}`.
- %OPTION% Mark the User class with the `SerializableAttribute` attribute.
- %OPTION% Declare the class as `private serializable class User {}`.

[Official documentation: SerializableAttribute Class](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.serializableattribute?view=net-5.0)

#### Q44. What is the difference between a static and non-static method?

- %OPTION% non-static methods always need to have a void return type
- %OPTION% non-static methods do not have access to static member variables
- %OPTION% static methods do not have to instantiate an instance of the class to call the method
- %OPTION% static methods always have to be public

[Official documentation: Static Members](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/programming-guide/classes-and-structs/static-classes-and-static-class-members#static-members)

#### Q46. When will the code inside finally block be executed in a try-catch statement?

- %OPTION% if there is an error, it won't execute at all
- %OPTION% between the try and catch blocks
- %OPTION% after the try and catch blocks
- %OPTION% when the finally block overrides the catch block and executes in its place

[Official documentation: try-catch](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/language-reference/keywords/try-catch)

#### Q48. How are C# classes limited?

- %OPTION% They do not support multiple inheritance.
- %OPTION% They support multiple inheritance.
- %OPTION% They can have only a set number of properties.
- %OPTION% They can have only a set number of methods.

[Official documentation: Class inheritance](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/fundamentals/types/classes#class-inheritance)

#### Q49. What function do namespaces perform?

- %OPTION% Namespaces calculate code coverage at runtime.
- %OPTION% Namespaces compile application code together at compile time.
- %OPTION% Namespaces group code together into a single repository.
- %OPTION% Namespaces separate code into groupings, control access, and void naming collisions.

[Official documentation: namespace](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/language-reference/keywords/namespace)

#### Q51. What is a thread pool?

- %OPTION% a collection of synchronous methods created during initialization that cannot be reused
- %OPTION% a collection of threads created during initialization that can be reused
- %OPTION% a collection of threads only recognized at compile time that can be reused
- %OPTION% a collection of asynchronous methods created at compile time that cannot be reused

[Official documentation: ThreadPool Class](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.threading.threadpool?view=net-5.0)

#### Q52. When an object in C# is serialized, what is it converted to?

- %OPTION% XML
- %OPTION% JSON
- %OPTION% byte stream
- %OPTION% value stream

[Official documentation: Serialization](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/programming-guide/concepts/serialization/)

#### Q53. What is a delegate

- %OPTION% a variable that holds a reference to a value type and its content
- %OPTION% a specific value type that can be used only in callback methods
- %OPTION% a type that holds a reference to a method with a particular parameter list and return type
- %OPTION% a custom variable type that can be used in abstract classes

[Official documentation: Delegates](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/programming-guide/delegates/)

#### Q54. What are the four keywords associated with exception handling in C#?

- %OPTION% try, catch, valid, invalid
- %OPTION% try, valid, finally, throw
- %OPTION% try, catch, finally, throw
- %OPTION% finally, throw, valid, invalid

[Tutorial Point](https://www.tutorialspoint.com/csharp/csharp_exception_handling.htm#:~:text=Exceptions%20provide%20a%20way%20to,catch%2C%20finally%2C%20and%20throw.)

#### Q55. What is the main difference between the is and as operators?

- %OPTION% The is operator checks instance types, while the as operator checks the inherited type.
- %OPTION% The is operator checks primitive data types, while the as operator checks the object type.
- %OPTION% The as operator checks object type, while the is operator attempts to cast an object to a specific type.
- %OPTION% The is operator checks object type, while the as operator attempts to cast an object to a specific type.

[Pluralsight guide](https://www.pluralsight.com/guides/csharp-is-as-operators-is-expressions)

#### Q56. What is the difference between finally and finalize blocks?

- %OPTION% The finally block is called during the execution of a try and catch block, while the finalize method is called after garbage collection.
- %OPTION% The finally block is called after the execution of a try and catch block, while the finalize method is called just before garbage collection.
- %OPTION% The finalize block is called before the execution of a try and catch block, while the finally method is called just before garbage collection.
- %OPTION% The finalize block is called during the execution of a try and catch block, while the finally method is called after garbage collection.

[C-sharpcorner](https://www.c-sharpcorner.com/forums/final-finally-and-finalize)

#### Q60. What is the main difference between a value type and a reference type?

- %OPTION% A value type can be any primitive type, while reference types must be type-agnostic.
- %OPTION% A value type refers to another value, while a reference type refers to a value in memory.
- %OPTION% A value type stores an actual value, while a reference type is a pointer to a value.
- %OPTION% A value type is available only at runtime, while a reference type is available only at compile time.

1. [Official documentation: Value types](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/language-reference/builtin-types/value-types)
2. [Official documentation: Reference types](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/language-reference/keywords/reference-types)

#### Q61. What is the difference between the `break` and `continue` keywords?

- %OPTION% The `break` keyword is used to break out of multiple iteration statements, while `continue` can only break out of code blocks that have single iterations.
- %OPTION% The `break` keyword literally breaks out of a control flow statement, while `continue` ignores the rest of the control statement or iteration and starts the next one.
- %OPTION% The `break` keyword literally breaks out of the current control flow code and stops it dead, while `continue` keeps executing the code after an exception is thrown.
- %OPTION% The `break` keyword jumps out of an iteration and then proceeds with the rest of the control flow code, while `continue` stops the executing code dead.

[Official documentation: Jump statements](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/language-reference/statements/jump-statements)

#### Q62. Which code snippet correctly declares a variable named userId with a public `get` and private `set`?

- %OPTION% `public int userID <get, set>;`
- %OPTION% `public int userID [get, private set];`
- %OPTION% `public int userID { get; private set; }`
- %OPTION% `public int userID = { public get, private set };`

[Official documentation: Properties](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/properties)

#### Q63. What is true about virtual methods?

- %OPTION% `Overriding virtual methods in a derived class is mandatory.`
- %OPTION% `Overriding virtual methods in a derived class is not possible.`
- %OPTION% `Virtual methods always need a default implementation.`
- %OPTION% `Virtual methods cannot have default implementation.`

1. [Official documentation: virtual](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/language-reference/keywords/virtual)
2. [c-sharpcorner: Virtual Method in C#](https://www.c-sharpcorner.com/UploadFile/3d39b4/virtual-method-in-C-Sharp/)

#### Q64. What is likely to happen if you have multiple threads accessing the same resource in your program?

- %OPTION% `resource overload`
- %OPTION% `thread jumping`
- %OPTION% `deadlock and race conditions`
- %OPTION% `nothing, since this is what threading is for`

[Official documentation: race conditions](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/archive/msdn-magazine/2008/october/concurrency-hazards-solving-problems-in-your-multithreaded-code)

#### Q65. How do you indicate that a string might be null?

- %OPTION% `A string cannot be nullable.`
- %OPTION% `string? myVariable`
- %OPTION% `string myVariable = null`
- %OPTION% `string(null) myVariable`

#### Q66. Do you need to declare an out variable before you use it?

- %OPTION% `No, you can declare an out in the parameter list.`
- %OPTION% `Out variables are no longer part of C#.`
- %OPTION% `You must declare it if it is a primitive type.`
- %OPTION% `Yes.`

#### Q67. How would you access the last two people in an array named People?

- %OPTION% `People[..^2]`
- %OPTION% `You cannot do this in C#.`
- %OPTION% `People[..^3]`
- %OPTION% `People[^2]`

Explain: You **can** do this in C#. However, none of the above answers are correct. You could access the last two items by using `People[^2..]`. Please see [issue #3354](https://github.com/Ebazhanov/linkedin-skill-assessments-quizzes/issues/3354) for more information.
See also: [Official Documentation: Ranges](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/language-reference/proposals/csharp-8.0/ranges)

#### Q68. When can anonymous types be created?

- %OPTION% `at compile time`
- %OPTION% `after runtime`
- %OPTION% `at runtime`
- %OPTION% `after compile time`

[C-sharpcorner: Anonymous Types](https://www.c-sharpcorner.com/UploadFile/ff2f08/anonymous-types-in-C-Sharp/)

#### Q69. What is true about thread multitasking?

- %OPTION% `Thread multitasking allows code to be executed concurrently`
- %OPTION% `Thread multitasking allows code to be executed only when handling a user event.`
- %OPTION% `Thread multitasking blocks code from being executed simultaneously to guard memory.`
- %OPTION% `Thread multitasking adds single-threaded code blocks together.`

[Official Documentation: Threads](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/threading/threads-and-threading)

#### Q70. What accessibility level does this class field have ?

`private string LastName;`

- %OPTION% It can be used by other code only in the same class or struct.
- %OPTION% It can be used by other code in a referenced assembly.
- %OPTION% It can be used only by code contained in a derived class.
- %OPTION% It can be used by other code in the same assembly.

[Official Documentation: Accessibility Levels](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/language-reference/keywords/accessibility-levels)

#### Q71. How would you correctly declare a jagged array called 'partyInvites' with 10 empty elements?

- %OPTION% `string[] partyInvites = new string[10];`
- %OPTION% `string[][] partyInvites = new string[10][];`
- %OPTION% `string[][] partyInvites = new string[10]();`
- %OPTION% `string <[]> partyInvites = new string <[10]>;`

[Official Documentation: Jagged Arrays](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/programming-guide/arrays/jagged-arrays)

#### Q74. Which statement is True?

- %OPTION% All are true.
- %OPTION% None are true.
- %OPTION% string is a value type.
- %OPTION% string is an alias for String

en.TITLE: Skill Assessments Quizzes
en.DESC:
Collection of questions and answers on different subjects aimed to help
you test your knowledge before an important job interview!

Data from __data__. UI by __bandinopla__

es.TITLE: Questionarios de evaluación de habilidades
es.DESC:
Colección de preguntas y respuestas sobre diferentes temas orientadas a
ayudarte a testear tu conocimiento antes de una importante entrevista de trabajo! 

Datos de __data__. UI por __bandinopla__
